remarks: Lemma for ~ heibor .  The previous lemmas establish that the sequence ` M ` is Cauchy, so using completeness we now consider the convergent point ` Y ` .  By assumption, ` U ` is an open cover, so ` Y ` is an element of some ` Z e. U ` , and some ball centered at ` Y ` is contained in ` Z ` .  But the sequence contains arbitrarily small balls close to ` Y ` , so some element ` ball ( M `` n ) ` of the sequence is contained in ` Z ` .  And finally we arrive at a contradiction, because ` { Z } ` is a finite subcover of ` U ` that covers ` ball ( M `` n ) ` , yet ` ball ( M `` n ) e. K ` .  For convenience, we write this contradiction as ` ph -> ps ` where ` ph ` is all the accumulated hypotheses and ` ps ` is anything at all.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 22-Jan-2014.)
